title: 'Who will pay for it?': SC raps Tamil Nadu govt for promising free electricity; flags 'freebie' politics
content: The Supreme Court has criticized the Tamil Nadu electricity board's promise of free electricity to all consumers. The apex court expressed concern that such freebies, regardless of financial need, hinder national economic development. It noted that states often offer these schemes, funded by taxpayer money, without proper budgetary justification.

title: Now, domestic violence legal in Taliban-led Afghanistan — as long as no ‘broken bones, open wounds’
content: Afghanistan's new penal code, signed by the Taliban's supreme leader, permits husbands to physically abuse wives and children without causing severe injury. It formalizes inequality, with different penalties for 'free' individuals and 'slaves.' Psychological and sexual violence against women are not explicitly prohibited, leaving them vulnerable and without adequate legal recourse.

title: At AI Summit, PM Modi’s nameplate carries a ‘Bharat’ message
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the global community at the AI Impact Summit to leverage technological disruption as humanity's greatest opportunity, emphasizing "right action" guided by "right understanding." The summit also saw the country's nameplate displayed as "Bharat," a recurring practice at official global events, sparking renewed discussion.

title: ‘Asked for details of pending dues’: Lucknow woman slaps, assaults electricity department employees
content: A woman allegedly stormed a Lucknow power substation, assaulting staff and tearing documents after her home's electricity was disconnected. Nidhi Sharma reportedly became agitated when asked for account details, leading to a physical altercation where employees were injured. Police have registered an FIR and are investigating.

title: As Anthropic and Pentagon cannot stop fighting, here's who said what
content: AI giant Anthropic is in a dispute with the US Department of Defense over the deployment of its AI models. The Pentagon insists on unrestricted lawful use, while Anthropic seeks assurances against autonomous weapons and domestic spying. This disagreement could impact Anthropic's $200 million contract and its position as the sole AI provider on classified military networks.

title: 'Can I get a Shiv Shambhu?': Grammy winner SZA’s viral Mahashivratri moment at Isha Yoga Center
content: Grammy-winning artist SZA recently embarked on a personal spiritual journey in India, seeking stillness and balance beyond her demanding global career. Her visit included a silent retreat and participation in Mahashivratri at the Isha Yoga Center, showcasing a deep dive into mindfulness and cultural immersion.

title: 'India used to fear us': Pakistan's Amir, Ali blast Shadab for digs at seniors
content: Mohammad Amir said Pakistan no longer commands the fear it did in the 1990s, especially against India. Shahid Afridi called for dropping senior players, which angered Shadab Khan, who reminded critics they also never beat India in World Cups. Basit Ali criticised Shadab’s comments and questioned his performances, sharing an anecdote about taking away his phones on a past tour.

title: T20 World Cup: Albie vs Morne Morkel alongside India vs South Africa in Super Eight
content: South Africa's bowling consultant Albie Morkel lightened the mood ahead of their UAE clash, joking about his brother Morne's role with India.  Albie's focus on yorkers and building confidence has bolstered the Proteas' formidable pace attack, with bowlers like Lungi Ngidi and Marco Jansen excelling.  He credits Stephen Fleming for shaping his player-centric coaching approach.

title: 'Had knives, petrol, chainsaw': Techie held grudge against pregnant ex-wife, gored her to death
content: A 29-year-old software professional was allegedly murdered by her former husband inside her Hyderabad apartment. The accused, who had previously lived in Canada, was apprehended after a standoff where he threatened to set the room on fire. The victim had divorced him last year and filed a domestic violence case.

title: Explained: What is India’s Sarvam AI model that Google CEO Sundar Pichai is impressed with
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai lauded Sarvam AI for its groundbreaking work in developing AI models tailored for Indian languages and contexts. The startup's AI reportedly outperforms major global models like Gemini and ChatGPT in specific benchmarks, showcasing advanced capabilities in visual understanding and document analysis for India's diverse linguistic landscape.

title: Mukesh Ambani says Jio, RIL to invest Rs 10L cr on AI; believes AI won’t kill jobs
content: Speaking to attendees, Mukesh Ambani conveyed optimism that AI would broaden economic prospects instead of diminishing them. He maintained that fears surrounding large-scale job losses are misplaced

title: Ranji Trophy: J&K dare to dream under pressure – A big leap long in the making
content: Jammu and Kashmir's remarkable journey to the Ranji Trophy final, marked by self-belief and meticulous planning, has transformed them into title contenders. Coach Ajay Sharma's patient approach and the development of a core group of talented young players, supported by improved infrastructure and pre-season exposure, have been pivotal to this success.

title: Income Tax notice alert! Senior execs with over Rs 50L salary under radar - Here's why
content: In many instances, the taxpayers are alleged to have sought tax relief by reporting bogus donations to religious bodies, charitable organisations, or educational institutions.

title: Relief for Honey Rose: High Court cancels GST notice against the 'Rachel' actress
content: The Kerala High Court has quashed a GST notice demanding Honey Rose's tax records for multiple years in one go, stating separate requests are necessary. Meanwhile, her upcoming film 'Rachel', where she plays a butcher, has been postponed again, with makers citing release landscape concerns for a better audience experience.

title: T20 World Cup: India's worrying batting patterns and struggles vs off-spin
content: India have won all four group-stage matches at the T20 World Cup, but cracks have emerged, particularly against off-spin in the middle overs. Fixed batting roles and slow scoring by Suryakumar Yadav and Tilak Varma have hurt momentum, giving opponents a clear blueprint. Rivals like South Africa will target this weakness, and India must urgently address their middle-overs approach ahead of the Super Eights.

title: Ex-South Korea president Yoon sentenced to life imprisonment for 'insurrection'
content: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol received a life sentence for insurrection after declaring martial law in December 2024, a move the court deemed a plot to paralyze the National Assembly. The declaration, though brief and without casualties, led to his impeachment and subsequent trials. Two cabinet members also faced convictions in related cases.

title: ‘Cultural insensitivity’: Mamata slams PM Modi over ‘Swami’ prefix to Ramakrishna’s name
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for using the prefix 'Swami' for Sri Sri Ramakrishna Paramahamsadeva on his birth anniversary. Banerjee stated this displayed cultural insensitivity, as the saint was revered as 'Thakur,' with 'Swami' being a title for his disciples. Modi had earlier paid tributes to Swami Ramakrishna Paramahansa.

title: Why is stock market down today? Top reasons for crash
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex tanked in trade on Thursday after three consecutive days of gains. While Nifty50 went below 25,600, BSE Sensex crashed over 800 points.

title: AI summit: Tata Sons' chair's expansion pitch, Google CEO’s ‘vision’ — who said what
content: India is hosting the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, bringing together global leaders to discuss artificial intelligence. Discussions focused on democratizing AI, building sovereign capabilities, and ensuring inclusive growth. Leaders emphasized AI's transformative potential across sectors like healthcare and education. The summit highlighted India's growing role as a trusted AI hub in the Global South.

title: DMDK joins DMK-led alliance for Tamil Nadu polls; Premallatha Vijayakant meets Stalin
content: DMDK has officially joined the DMK alliance, marking its first partnership with the party since its inception in 2005. General secretary Premallatha Vijayakant confirmed the decision after meeting with Chief Minister M.K. Stalin. Seat-sharing discussions are ongoing, with a Rajya Sabha seat anticipated for DMDK.

title: Chatfishing: Is AI creeping into your dating life? Here's how to fix it
content: Online dating is facing a new challenge: chatfishing, where AI crafts messages for users. This trend, supported by studies, makes connections feel superficial and heartbreak harder to detect.  Experts advise quick transitions to voice or video calls to verify authenticity and prevent emotional deception.

title: India vs SA: ‘Baby AB’ Dewald Brevis unfazed by Varun Chakravarthy threat
content: India and South Africa gear up for a T20 World Cup Super 8 clash, with a key battle potentially involving Varun Chakravarthy and Dewald Brevis.  Dubbed 'Baby AB', Brevis, unfazed by the spinner, aims to leverage his IPL experience.  He showed glimpses of form against UAE, emphasising positivity and backing his game.

title: ‘Give AI an open sky, but ...’: PM Modi hails AI, flags caution — top quotes
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasized democratizing AI for human-centric development at the AI Impact Summit. He highlighted India's talent and policy clarity, inviting global collaboration. Modi unveiled the MANAV Vision for ethical, accountable, and inclusive AI, stressing the need for global standards and child safety in the evolving digital landscape.

title: Why a far-Left French MP is under-fire for a nationalist's death
content: Arnault himself is not accused of involvement in the violence. He has stated that he initiated procedures to dismiss a staff member following the arrest and said he would cooperate fully with investigators.

title: Man who 'sold' the Taj Mahal: The strange, audacious life of India’s most legendary conman
content: Mithilesh Kumar Srivastava, known as Natwarlal, was an extraordinary Indian trickster who became a synonym for deception. He masterfully used psychological brilliance and forged documents to pull off audacious scams, including allegedly selling iconic Indian landmarks. His ability to manipulate trust and authority made him an elusive legend.

title: Inside 'Jana Nayagan' actor's Rs 80-crore property
content: Thalapathy Vijay's opulent Neelankarai beachfront home, valued at Rs 70-80 crores, boasts modern coastal design with private amenities. Meanwhile, director H Vinoth expressed concern over the lack of support for his delayed film 'Jana Nayagan,' contrasting it with support for other controversial movies. Vijay's 'Theri' is set for a re-release.

title: 'You immigrant of Korean descent': US professor defends Indian-American visibility
content: A social media spat over Indian presence in Texas has ignited national debate. Commentators are discussing immigration, cultural shifts and belonging. The Dallas-Fort Worth area sees a growing Indian-American community. Concerns about rapid change are voiced, while others highlight the benefits of diversity. Discussions touch on economic impacts and the need for nuanced understanding of immigrant contributions.

title: Salim Khan hospitalization: Salman leaves hospital after checking on his father; avoids media
content: The entertainment world is on edge as veteran writer Salim Khan is hospitalized due to a minor brain hemorrhage. Salman Khan, his beloved son and superstar, was seen exiting Lilavati Hospital earlier today after spending time with his father in the ICU. Although Salim requires a ventilator, doctors believe he is on the path to recovery.

title: ‘Ticked all the boxes’: Suryakumar sends Super 8s warning after dominant run
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav expressed confidence after his team's dominant group stage performance in the ongoing T20 World Cup. He highlighted that the team has "ticked almost all the boxes" and is ready for the Super 8s, citing Shivam Dube's crucial innings and the team's bowling flexibility as key strengths.

title: Hardik Pandya shares intimate birthday post for girlfriend Mahieka
content: Hardik Pandya shared a birthday post for girlfriend Mahieka Sharma, calling her “my princess.” He confirmed their relationship in late 2025 after divorcing Natasa Stankovic. Mahieka has been seen with his son Agastya and helped motivate him to rediscover his cricketing potential. On Valentine’s Day 2026, Hardik got an ‘M’ and leopard tattoo symbolising their strong bond and mutual support.

title: 'He's a murderer': Wasim’s ex-wife seeks help from PM Sharif, Naqvi
content: Imad Wasim’s ex-wife Sannia Ashfaq accused him of forcing her to abort their child in 2023, cheating on her, and threatening her during pregnancy. She shared posts, videos, and messages claiming emotional and physical trauma and called him a “murderer.” Ashfaq urged a boycott of Islamabad United and requested an investigation by Pakistan’s PM and PCB chief.

title: ‘When friends connect’: French President Macron shares AI image with PM Modi
content: French President Emmanuel Macron visited India and met Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He shared an AI-generated image of the two leaders. Macron attended the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi. The summit focused on responsible and development-focused AI. India is hosting the global AI gathering. Leaders discussed AI's future and its impact on people, planet, and progress.

title: ‘Do not give away Diego Garcia’: Trump cautions UK amid US-Iran tensions
content: US President Donald Trump urged the UK not to "give away" the Diego Garcia base, deeming it crucial for potential US military action against Iran. This statement contradicts official US policy, which supports Britain's agreement to transfer sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius while retaining a 100-year lease on the base.

title: Left Pakistan, became hero for Canada: How cricket found Saad Bin Zafar
content: Saad Bin Zafar moved from Pakistan to Canada in 2004 for education, with cricket initially just a hobby. After years of inconsistency, he became a key player and leader for Canada, helping regain ODI status and starring in the 2026 T20 World Cup. Balancing studies, jobs, and cricket, he eventually went full-time in 2018.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Sona BLW Precision Forgings, PFC, and NLC India are the top stocks that Aakash K Hindocha, Deputy Vice President - WM Research of Nuvama Professional Clients Group recommends buying today. Here is the expert’s view on Nifty, Bank Nifty for February 19, 2026:

title: Smoke in cockpit, engine failure: JetBlue flight makes emergency landing in New Jersey
content: A JetBlue flight bound for West Palm Beach returned to Newark Liberty International Airport shortly after takeoff Wednesday due to an engine problem that caused smoke in the cockpit. The aircraft landed safely, and passengers and crew evacuated via slides. The incident led to a temporary flight suspension and delays.

title: Is the gym helping or harming your joints? Here's what doctor says
content: Gym culture often glorifies effort, leading many to ignore injuries as 'normal' or a sign of weakness. Social media's portrayal of perfect workouts exacerbates this, with individuals copying advanced routines without considering their own limitations. Experts warn that poor form, overtraining, and neglecting rest can lead to significant joint damage, emphasizing that pain signals a problem, not a challenge.

title: 'Hum dispresan mein hain': Memes storm internet after Babar Azam demoted against Namibia
content: Babar Azam faced online backlash during Pakistan's T20 World Cup match against Namibia, not getting a chance to bat. Despite being a key player, his recent form has been questioned. Team management opted for aggressive batters ahead of him, sparking fan criticism and memes about his role and the team's strategy.

title: Congress a divided house in Kerala, has no leader to match stature of Pinarayi Vijayan: K.V. Thomas
content: K.V. Thomas, Kerala’s Special Representative with Cabinet rank in New Delhi, discusses the State’s political landscape, financial challenges, and prospects for the Left ahead of Assembly elections. He says Kerala has been pushed to ‘the brink of a financial crisis for political reasons’

content: DMDK general secretary Premallatha Vijayakant said, “Our leader, Captain (Vijayakant), wanted this to happen in 2016 itself.”

title: Malayalis roast ‘The Kerala Story 2’ trailer with ‘beef-porotta’ jibes on social media
content: Malayalis, especially women, mock a scene featuring a detained woman rejecting beef by flooding the Internet with memes and videos celebrating the dish. The backlash has drawn sharp criticism from political leaders as well

title: Macron tells AI summit he's determined to 'shape rules' with allies
content: "We are determined to continue to shape the rules of the game... with our allies such as India," Macron said in New Delhi

title: India has central role to play amid challenges around AI's potential misuse, says Anthropic’s CEO
content: During his address at India AI Impact Summit 2026, Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said India has historically set a standard for the Global South

content: Referring to concerns about job loss in the age of artificial intelligence, he said such fears were often exaggerated

content: Union Minister Vaishnaw said PM Modi has announced a big policy shift aimed at attracting world's data to India, to be processed here and to deliver high-value services to the world

content: Inaugurating the AI Impact Summit’s plenary session, the prime minister said that AI heralds a “profound transformation” in history

content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Deputy CMs Eknath Shinde and Sunetra Pawar also attended the celebrations at the fort on Thursday

content: Sundar Pichai says AI will undeniably reshape workforce, automating some roles, evolving others and creating entirely new careers

content: The State Budget outlines an ambitious roadmap to develop Ahmedabad as an “Olympic Ready City” in the run-up to the 2030 Commonwealth Games, which Gujarat will host

title: Amit Shah skips SIR talk in Matua outreach at West Bengal event
content: Home Minister Amit Shah visited Mayapur, the birthplace of the Bhakti movement, to highlight the Matua community's role in unifying Hindu society. He praised reformers Harichand and Guruchand Thakur for their social welfare initiatives and described Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati as a bridge to modernity. Shah conveyed PM Modi's greetings, emphasizing the spread of the 'Viksit Bharat' and Sanatan dharma messages globally.

content: An official press release here said that the cell would have four members including officials from the Tourism Department and Guidance Tamil Nadu

content: The remarks came in the backdrop of Washington's claim that New Delhi has agreed to stop importing Russian crude oil

content: The bench comprising Justice Dinesh Kumar Singh and Expert Member Dr. Sujit Kumar Bajpayee directed to conduct the survey and ascertain the scale of excavation and possible damage to the premier cancer treatment and research facility

title: Rajasthan Speaker orders investigation into food item purchase at tribal hostels
content: Opposition Congress MLAs expressed dissatisfaction with Tribal Area Development Minister Babulal Kharadi’s reply to a question regarding the prices and quality of food items supplied to the hostels

content: In a letter sent on February 17 and available in public domain on February 18, Mr. Singh said that the name of Bill Gates, owner of Microsoft and chairman of the Bill Gates & Melinda Gates Foundation, has appeared in the Epstein Files.

content: Kabaddi Maran, a community leader, said that both Central and State governments are vying with each other to make money out of the coast in the name of economic development.

content: Mohan Bhagwat's remarks assume significance, as they come amid the recent tariff controversy with the U.S.

title: Rajya Sabha polls on March 16; DMK, AIADMK to accommodate allies
content: Both parties are faced with a situation where they have to fulfil the demand of some smaller parties to allot a Rajya Sabha berth as a condition for an alliance in the Assembly polls.

title: Multi-speciality hospitals to be set up in State under PPP model
content: The initiative aims at strengthening healthcare access across the State, Health Minister Satya Kumar informs Legislative Assembly

title: Bill passed allowing voter registration in PR institutions four times a year
content: The amendment allows voter registration on four qualifying dates each year — January 1, April 1, July 1, and October 1, and aligns Panchayat Raj institutions with the existing system followed for Assembly and Parliament elections

title: Govt. to further simplify process of deleting private lands from 22A list
content: Speaker Ayyanna Patrudu notes that land issues persist across the State and stresses effective implementation of guidelines

title: Road transport corporation employees call for ‘Bengaluru Chalo’ protest despite partial arrears release
content: JAC urged all KSRTC employees to participate in the protest in large numbers and clarified that there was no change in the ‘Bengaluru Chalo’ programme

content: The operation underscores the changing security landscape in Gadchiroli, where the administration is focusing on development and security after years of insurgency

content: Kerala says High Court intruded into matters of public policy by putting on hold government’s ‘Nava Keralam Citizen Response Programme’

content: The seer claims that trees and vegetation surrounding the Raghav Chaitanya Shivalinga on the Ladle Mashak Dargah’s premises had been cleared and a platform-like structure had been constructed at the spot recently.

content: Vibrant Village Programme, originally aimed at areas along China border, will now be launched in villages along  Pakistan, Nepal, Bangladesh, Bhutan, and Myanmar also

content: He said that the original movie was a malicious lie that sought to malign Kerala and undermine its secular social fabric.

content: CRPF-led “KGH-2” targets top CPI (Maoist) leadership as government pushes to end left-wing extremism by March 2026

title: Watch: Anganwadi workers across T.N. intensify protest over pay and job regularisation
content: Anganwadi and nutritious meal workers across Tamil Nadu have continued their agitation for the 15th consecutive day, demanding regularisation and a ₹19,500 minimum basic pay promised in the DMK’s 2021 manifesto

content: Speed of Doing Business policy should be the guiding principle in all matters related to industrial projects, says Naidu

content: The Major League Baseball Players Association unanimously elected Bruce Meyer as its interim executive director Wednesday, the union announced.

content: The U.S. men are moving on to the semifinals at the Olympics thanks to Quinn Hughes, after needing extra hockey to get through the quarterfinals Wednesday against Sweden.

title: Report: Hornets' Ball uninjured after car crash
content: LaMelo Ball was not injured after being involved in a two-car crash in downtown Charlotte on Wednesday, a source told The Associated Press.

content: The Golden State Warriors will be without star guard Stephen Curry when they exit the All-Star break on Thursday night against the Boston Celtics and the length of his ongoing absence is unclear.

title: Creighton's Dix stars vs. UConn after mom's death
content: Josh Dix scored 21 points to lead Creighton to a 91-84 win over No. 5 UConn on Wednesday night, two weeks after his mother died from colon cancer.

content: No. 4 Arizona got back in the win column after back-to-back losses by overcoming AJ Dybantsa's 35-point night to defeat BYU 75-68.

content: Darius Acuff Jr. scored the second-most points in a college basketball game this season and had the ball in his hands for the final shot as Arkansas fell to Alabama.

content: Ronda Rousey and Gina Carano will undergo extensive medical and neurological testing ahead of their May 16 MMA comeback clash, according to the California State Athletic Commission.

content: We spoke to execs around the league to learn what they're up to while many players are in Milan Cortina.

title: The Bilas Index: Ranking the top 68 teams in men's college basketball
content: With a month until Selection Sunday, Bilas reveals which teams he has at the top of the pecking order.

title: NBA Finals odds: Thunder, Nuggets still big favorites, Cavs volatile after Harden trade
content: The Cavs' title odds improved with the trade for James Harden, but the Thunder and Nuggets are clear favorites.

title: Ryan Garcia has the fame, but can he win a boxing world title?
content: Ryan Garcia is a supremely talented fighter at a career crossroads. Can he lock in and finally win a world championship?

title: Rousey vs. Carano is a sign of the times -- with a silver lining
content: Ronda Rousey vs. Gina Carano is an opportunity for two pioneers of women's MMA to have a night in the spotlight they created.

title: Barcelona transfer questions: Let Lewandowski, Rashford go? Sign a top striker or defender?
content: Everything seemed to be falling into place for Barcelona, but losing the top spot in LaLiga has exposed squad issues that must be addressed this summer.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG, Liverpool join race for Villa star Rogers
content: Paris Saint-Germain and Liverpool have joined the race to sign Aston Villa attacking midfielder Morgan Rogers.

title: Galgotias Rep Neha Singh's "Open To Work" LinkedIn Pic Viral After Robot Row
content: Galgotias University's Neha Singh is under fire for showcasing a Chinese robotic dog at the India AI Impact Summit, claiming it was developed by her educational institution.

title: F-22 Raptors, F-35 Lightnings: US Unleashes Massive Air Armada, Iran Watches
content: The US military has assembled the greatest amount of air power in the Middle East since the 2003 invasion of Iraq by sending significant numbers of cutting-edge F-35 and F-22 jet fighters and support aircraft to the region.

title: AI Cold War On Stage: OpenAI, Anthropic CEOs' Awkward Moment At Delhi Summit
content: A light-hearted yet widely noticed awkward moment unfolded during the group photograph at the India AI Impact Summit in New Delhi today, as OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei chose raised fists instead of holding hands.

title: Girls, Some As Young As 14, Forced Into Sex To Clear Debts In London: Report
content: Women and girls, some as young as 14, have been subject to forced sex by criminal gangs in London, according to a report.

title: South Korea Court Gives Ex-President Life In Prison For Insurrection
content: A South Korean court sentenced ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison, finding him guilty of leading an insurrection when he abruptly declared martial law in 2024.

title: Don't Want Flying Ban? See New Definitions Of "Unruly Behaviour" On Flight
content: The civil aviation regulator DGCA has added six new categories of what can be defined as "unruly behaviour" in a flight.

title: Anil Ambani Gets Fresh Summons For February 26 In Money Laundering Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has issued fresh summons to Reliance Group chairman Anil Ambani to appear for questioning on February 26 after he skipped deposition this week, official sources said on Thursday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Will Iran Actually Use Its Catastrophic 'Strait Of Hormuz' Card Against US?
content: Should the US launch any attacks on Iran - and every indication is that it means to very soon - it will be to implement a regime change. In which case, Iran could be forced to adopt extraordinary measures.

title: Trump Administration Expands ICE Authority To Detain Refugees
content: The Trump administration has given immigration officers broader powers to detain legal refugees awaiting a green card to ensure they are "re-vetted".

title: US Justice Department Probes Warner Sale's Impact on Theaters
content: The US Justice Department has summoned some of the country's largest theater chains to private conversations about the potential impact of a sale of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: OpenAI, Tata To Build Data Centre Infrastructure In India
content: US ChatGPT maker OpenAI and IT giant Tata Consultancy Services announced a plan to build data centre infrastructure in the South Asian country currently hosting a major artificial intelligence summit.

title: J&K's Crackdown On 'Unauthorised' Ramadan Donations To Block Terror Funding
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district, directives have been issued to prevent diversion of Ramadan donations to unlawful and subversive activities.

title: Bengaluru Woman Bleeds Out After Attack As Helpless Husband Lies Motionless
content: A 70-year-old woman was murdered in her home in Bengaluru's Nelamangala while her mentally challenged husband lay beside her, apparently unaware of the attack.

title: Jeffrey Epstein's Ties To Politicians, Business Titans And Other Figures
content: The US Justice Department's release of millions of internal documents related to Jeffrey Epstein has revealed the late financier and sex offender's ties to many prominent people.

title: Afghan Barbers Under Pressure As Morality Police Take On Short Beards
content: Barbers in Afghanistan risk detention for trimming men's beards too short, they told AFP, as the Taliban authorities enforce their strict interpretation of Islamic law with increasing zeal.

title: 3 Delhi Schools Receive Bomb Threat E-Mails, Search Ops Underway
content: At least three schools in Delhi received bomb threats through e-mail on Thursday morning, prompting swift evacuation and search operations by emergency agencies, an official of the Delhi Fire Services said.

title: 'Stop Invasion': MAGA Leader Questions Presence Of Hanuman Statue In US
content: A Texas Republican leader has come under fire over his remarks on a 90-foot statue of Lord Hanuman—known as the 'Statue of Union'—in the US city.

title: Rs 50,000 Cash, And Signal Chats: Revelations In Rohit Shetty House Firing
content: In a major revelation in connection with the firing outside filmmaker Rohit Shetty's home, investigators have found that a sum of Rs 3 lakh was promised to the shooters for the job

title: 57% Conviction, 14% FIRs, 0.6% Courtroom Guilt: Inside Madhya Pradesh's Anti-Corruption Paradox
content: According to the government, between 2020 and 2025, the Economic Offences Wing secured convictions in 40 out of 70 criminal cases that reached a verdict, while 30 ended in acquittal.
